intro: Remijia amazonica var. paraensis, commonly known as the Paraense Remijia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near rivers and in dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
